oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Slide Collection - Nativity Display at Centennial Park
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Opened on Thanksgiving Eve of 1953 and displayed yearly during the Christmas season, the nativity scene at Centennial Park was a gift to the city of Nashville given by Fred Harvey. It was created by sculptor Guido Rabacini and executed by the Silvestri Art Manufacturing Co. of Chicago at a cost of $20,000. The last year the nativity scene was on display was 1967. 35 mm
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Rabacini, Guido
Centennial Park; Silvestri Art Manufacturing Co. of Chicago
Sports and recreation; Parks
Nashville (Tenn.)
